sentences.sContent: His eyes were focussed straight ahead.
...Some math training programs primarily focus on raising students’ math scores...
...Most of us find it hard to focus on our immediate tasks because of internet distractions 41...
...You elected us to focus on your jobs...
...What is the focus of the mentioned plan...
...That's the focus of the plan I talked about throughout the campaign...
...there is a focus on the practical...
...a company with its focus on social media to boost its brand recognition stands a better chance of standing out from the crowd...
...The Consumer Electronics Show in recent years has begun to focus more on the practical value than the showiness of electronic devices...
...Studying at university will only become less attractive if employers shift their focus away from where someone went to university—and there is no sign of that happening anytime soon...

synos.tran: 集中；[光][摄]聚焦；调节焦距

phrases.pCn: 焦点没对准的；模糊不清的
n. 焦点小组；典型群众
分众传媒控股有限公司
福特福克斯（美国汽车公司）
集中化战略；焦点策略；集中战略
自动调焦，自动对焦；电子调焦；自动聚焦

remMethod.val: foc(看作for， 为了) ＋ us → 焦点访谈的口号是为人民大众服务 → 焦点

words.tran: 焦点的，在焦点上的；灶的，病灶的
使集中在一点上；调节…的焦距

trans.tranOther: to give special attention to one particular person or thing, or to make people do this
the thing, person, situation etc that people pay special attention to
